number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												I thought I would enjoy this game despite the critics... I was wrong. It's not awful, but it's clunky and uninspired. You will soon enough realize you are far from the only one who is alive (I certainly didn't feel like a ''lone survivor'' for long... maybe 5 minutes of gameplay?), and the reason for the death of the majority of the population is never explained in any satisfying way. Though the game itself is only moderately challenging, the clunky controls and camera and awful combat make it fairly annoying to play. There is survival aspects at play here, and some work fairly well, but some game mechanics feel unnecessary or cliché. Last but not least, I Am Alive is very linear, which is very much a missed opportunity in this type of game. When you do try to explore, you are often reminded that ''you're going the wrong way'' or something along those lines.As I said above it's not an awful game, but there are so many much, much better games to play that I wouldn't recommend I Am Alive except if you are a complete fan of the genre and you've played every other game already, and it is on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 5, 2013
												Overall, the game was good.        I Am Alive features unique survival gameplay that is able to stand alone among similar games in the genre. Resources are scarce, combat is challenging, and the world seems to have a heavy, oppressive feel to it.         The game features a clever climbing system where the player must utilize stamina effectively, and a unique combat system that attepts to humanize the enemies.         Although the gameplay is fantastic it's storyline is not. It is short, only four or five hours long, and left me dissatisfied and empty (this meaning that there was no clear resolution to the story). But, despite that fact, I would still give the game a  7/10 or 8/10. It is worth a playthrough. But wait to get it while its on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 29, 2012
												An excellent, relatively short game (5-9 hours) characterized by realistic-looking post-apocalyptic settings that are quite stunning to behold. The level of attention to detail is downright impressive and really helps to immerse you within its story that is rather simple at its core but is enhanced by endearing moments & characters that feel and act like living, breathing human beings. I found that I cared about the main character's plight and mission and was invested in trying to make this hellish future into a better place by saving an adorable little girl, helping to reunite her with her absent mother, encountering other survivors and aiding them when I could and murdering opportunistic SOBs that preyed on the weak and innocent, JUSTICE IS SERVED beeyatches! xDThe gameplay itself is well-balanced with platforming elements that emphasize managing your limited stamina during its many awe-inspiring climbing portions that have you scaling the side of unmaintained skycrappers, clambering across elevated scaffolding and more while using pistons to pause and recuperate at opportune moments. It made these sections feel tense, as close to reality that a game can get and a lot of fun.Finally, the combat is also quite well-done as you can make charging gang members halt in their tracks by whipping out a gun, frightening them into holding their hands up as you either use this opportunity to back them into hazardous elements of the environments which is always a riot to watch unfold or blast them apart with well-placed shots. This is especially fun as you can do this while out of ammo but take too long and your opponents will wise up and charge you.9/10

												This is a great game that I enjoyed very much throughout my playthrough. It has a great dystopian atmosphere and despite some people's complaints, this blurry effect is so spot on that it makes you feel like you really are surrounded by dust (=the main reason why human life is facing extinction according to the plot). The only complaint I have is that its playtime is too short (about 6 to 9 hours long) and it feels like the ending was rushed a bit. content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												Overall he game deserves some credit, it is fairly fun to play, the visuals are great and the story element is moderately engrossing. It is a short game which actually worked in its favor, I feel if it was longer it would begin to sag in relation to the story and entertainment level. It isn't without its annoyances, for instance the enemy encounters are incredibly frustrating. Every time you face a small group of enemies ( 3-5) and you follow the same strategy. I won't go into detail but I felt as if the enemies were in a FPS game while I was within the limitations of a story/adventure game. (why do they get to swing their weapons freely while mine is always blocked in the same way).  The combat mechanic works well if the enemy encounters were less common but given their considerable influence on the game I feel that they could have been more dynamic. I recommend the game because it is short and therefore  it's shortcomings aren't overwhelmingly frustrating.Simply put,Rating-6/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												Before buying this game, I read the reviews like any normal person would. I found alot of people saying they hated the game. I did find quite a few positive reviews though and so I decided to go for it anyways. ( I think I only paid a few bucks for it during some sale )+ What I like:-Climbing/Stamina System    I love the climbing aspects of this game. I have to sit and carefully plan out my ascent or descent based on how much stamina I have at my disposal. Instead of blindly climbing like in Assasain's Creed, I have to think before I climb. This is the most realistic climbing I have ever seen in a game (in terms of stamina), and I love it so much.-Fighting    The fact that you can intimidate the enemy without any bullets and shove them down a hole is an A+ in my book! Seriously though, this game seems to have a similar theme, "Think before you act". I have found myself analyzing the enemy and finding who to kill first and how to do it. The intimidation that you can produce with an unloaded gun is spectacular and I find myself using it often.-Scenery     This game really sells the post-apocalyptic setting and between the dastardly ambushes and the unsettling music I find myslef on the edge of my seat.+ What I dislike    Honestly there really is not that much I truely dislike about this game. The limited retry is a bit troubling, but it forces me to take my time and analyze every situation. The fighting system is a little tough to get at first but once you get the hang of it, its not too bad.+ My Thoughts    I do indeed recommend this game. I would probably not have bought it if it had not been on sale, and I don't recommend paying $15 for it. If this game does end up going on sale then I recommend getting it, as you will most likely enjoy it as I have.    The trick to this game is to have patience and not rush into things. If you try to play this game like an FPS game, you will not enjoy it. This game is all about conserving the small pile of resources you have while trying to stay alive. It's a refreashing change from the FPS games I usually play.Thanks for reading my review,    TheBalmyScholar

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												Seriously though, this is a really good game. People don't give it enough credit.It really is a shame it isn't as well produced as it promised; the graphics suck, the main character's face gives me the creeps. The movements are awkward and the AI is really weird. Like, you're armed, and you point a gun at a guy, he'll stop and raise his hands. As soon as you put your gun down, he'll make a run for you, even if you're still looking at him. And then, you pull your gun back up and he'll stop. The concept is really really good, though, specially because you can do that even when you have no bullets at all, and they will kill you if you try to shoot when you run out of ammo.The survival element is the best thing here. It's been yeeeears since I've played a game that really got me scared that, at some point, I wouldn't have any supplies left. The first survival games I've played were probably the only ones to give me that feeling. You can manage the health supplies if you don't risk yourself too much (you'll probably have some of them left by the end of the game if you do that), but bullets are really hard to find. The story is also quite good. It's simple (literally just a guy trying to survive and find his family), and I won't spoil anything, but it really has a good take on that "main hero" figure every game usually has. You'll (hopefully) get it at the end.Overall, I have a feeling, and I♥♥♥♥♥♥you not, that this game would end up better than The Last of Us (given it has a similar concept of survival, except that it's way easier to survive on TLoU) if it had enough budget and less production problems. Saddly, this isn't what happened and the game has its technical issues, but I'd recomend it anyway. There aren't any problems that ruined my gameplay, so I believe it'll only make things look awkward sometimes at most. Even so, it's short and it's cheap by now, so I'd say go for it.

												Forget what IGN says about this game. Another great game from UBISOFT; there are some known actors and gameplay from SCC but that's fine. This game is psychological tension. 												Short but sweet, this is worth it if you can get it on sale. While the gameplay can be glitchy at times (often when I died, my gun remained in are while my body fell; once my body disappeared while playing), it's nothing that hampers gameplay.  And though the textures can be bland, the graphics are snazzed up by the fx, and look darn cool if you push this into the indie game category (which is really where it fits in to). For those looking for a Fallout fix, however, this is not quite the right game for you. This is not an expansive role playing game in which to emerse yourself. This game more of an indie gamers 'realistic' take on the post-apocalyptic genre (conserving ammo and supplies, tricking enemies. etc). I enjoyed it a lot, especially since it didn't cost me much to buy.

												People give I Am Alive a lot of crap for being short and linear (then they go back to playing CoD, oh the stupidity). number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												The game play mostly consists of 2 things: climbing and combat. Both are done a bit differently than usual.For climbing there is this whole stamina mechanic. The time you can spend hanging is limited and all actions drain it, some more than others, which can make things tense as your last strength fades and you are about to fall to your doom. So just plan your path when you can and rely on your wits when you can't.Combat is more tactical. A bullet is enough to kill. But those are rare and valuable. Thus it boils down to how many guys you can take out with the least amount of bullets. There are some options to achieve this, mostly through scare mechanic - pointing your gun at the enemy and manipulating them to some degree. Also, don't worry about missing your shots - the auto-aim is strong in this one.The story is simple and straight-forward. Optional exploring exists, but it's quite minimal. Visuals may look ugly at first, but the whole feel of it helps getting into the atmosphere. The one word that will come to your mind when reminded of this game will probably be ''gray''.If you have read this far and plan on playing, I can offer you these 2 tips: - Don't torture yourself too much with exploring the dust filled, lower streets. You will  get a gas mask  later on. - Helping the mysterious stranger will yield a cool and powerful weapon, which widens your combat options. Use it wisely.

												Although I'm not far into it, I'm prepared to say that this game is probably the best survival game I've ever played. The climbing/combat mechanics are totally unique, even if things don't work as planned all the time. I really enjoy the climbing sections, as they require a bit of strategy and energy management, so the solutions are not always obvious (but they're usually fair). The combat is great, too. Being required to intimidate and prioritize enemies adds some much needed nuance in the shooter genre. The story, from what I can tell, is well told which just adds to the whole experience. It's like Mirror's Edge, but slower and more deliberate. Check it out!

It made these sections feel tense, as close to reality that a game can get and a lot of fun.Finally, the combat is also quite well-done as you can make charging gang members halt in their tracks by whipping out a gun, frightening them into holding their hands up as you either use this opportunity to back them into hazardous elements of the environments which is always a riot to watch unfold or blast them apart with well-placed shots. This is especially fun as you can do this while out of ammo but take too long and your opponents will wise up and charge you.9/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Well, what to say? This game is prime example of missed opportunity for something extraordinary, but it failed on some crucial steps... but has shine on other. Game has some interesting and decent game mechanics and it plays good for most of time. There is occasional fighting with controls and weird key mapping on PC (you can change it) but nothing serious or unfixable. Atmosphere of game is phenomenal; torn up town looks amazing and feels real; even if at closer inspection lack of texture details and low poly models are quite visible, that is not "deal breaker".Main problem with game is story, ending and length; game can be finished in some 5h (I have repeat some areas to help all victims, so my overall play time was longer) and I got feeling like I just have started to play it. And even game it self went in direction like it will continue for at least 10h... but then it cuts and roles credits...Main character story never get's resolved while ending ruins any potential for sequels (I won't spoil it).Over all, game looks like it was rushed to be finished while production was still at 1/3 of development, so they just made cut there, made up some stupid ending and "VOILA!" game is done! And it's sad that potential this game had, was ruined in such stupid way...  And I can recommend it, but keep in mind what I have said; if that doesn't bother you and you want to feel great atmosphere game has, go for it (but get it on some BIG discount).Over all rating: 5/10

content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
												I would reccomed this game to others, but only if you get it on sale like I did. It was very suspensful and SUPER creepy. The layout and mapping system reminded me of Silent Hill Downpour, but the movement was a little like Assasians Creed. You are able to climb up skyscrapers, sparta kick people into firepits, use a crossbow, and much much more. Although, it was a little confusing on where you should go sometimes it was still pretty awesome. It was a shorter game, but there are some achievements that you can get.      The storyline was a little off. I wish that it showed more of him trying to get to his family instead of helping anothers. It left off on a cliffhanger, and I'm not too fond of it. Also, the checkpoints were your saving points. There is no place for you to save your game, becuase it automatically does so. That was probably the most annoying part of the game. (Besides the ridiculous solar contrasted rays of light in your eyes)      As for the items, there was always a supply of them. I never had any issues, except when climbing with the pitons. My only advice would be to use certain items sparingly (piton, bullets, medkits etc.) The other items (canned food/fruit, water, soda, painkillers, etc.) were always available if you looked around and scavenged. I ended the game with a lot more than what I needed.      Altogether, I thought that this was a very good game. It was really fun to play, and I would give it an 8/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 22, 2013
												A great post-apocalyptic survival game that's actually realistic. No zombies or mutants here, just the harsh environment and other people trying to survive. Food, items and ammo are scarce, and it really makes you think about conserving every bullet and morsel of food. Your actions in each situation can have big ramifications. Do you quickly draw your pistol and shoot a thug (and waste a bullet in the process), or threaten him with your loaded pistol and hope he backs off. Do you give your last can of food to a starving survivor, or keep it for yourself for when you need it the most. I found this game thought provoking and it left an emotional impact on me. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to play something more grounded in realism than the usual "blockbuster" style action game...

content:
Posted: January 5, 2013
												Overall, the game was good.        I Am Alive features unique survival gameplay that is able to stand alone among similar games in the genre. Resources are scarce, combat is challenging, and the world seems to have a heavy, oppressive feel to it.         The game features a clever climbing system where the player must utilize stamina effectively, and a unique combat system that attepts to humanize the enemies.         Although the gameplay is fantastic it's storyline is not. It is short, only four or five hours long, and left me dissatisfied and empty (this meaning that there was no clear resolution to the story). But, despite that fact, I would still give the game a  7/10 or 8/10. It is worth a playthrough. But wait to get it while its on sale.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												Although I'm not far into it, I'm prepared to say that this game is probably the best survival game I've ever played. The climbing/combat mechanics are totally unique, even if things don't work as planned all the time. I really enjoy the climbing sections, as they require a bit of strategy and energy management, so the solutions are not always obvious (but they're usually fair). The combat is great, too. Being required to intimidate and prioritize enemies adds some much needed nuance in the shooter genre. The story, from what I can tell, is well told which just adds to the whole experience. It's like Mirror's Edge, but slower and more deliberate. Check it out!

												Though interesting and very immersive, this post-apocalyptic survival does not allow for a lot of freedom. Areas are restrictive and not every solution a player has for a problem is supported; Knowing you can jump and climb doesn't mean a crate next to a fence will allow you to climb over that fence...and stuff like that. Extending that, it is a very linear game...The combat system and problems one is faced with are interesting though, and a player will have to bluff with an empty gun more than once. The developers also did a great job with the environment and allow the player to help people in need, if the player should choose to do so, depending on available resources.It is the kind of game I wouldn't play much, but do enjoy once in a while.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												Before buying this game, I read the reviews like any normal person would. I found alot of people saying they hated the game. I did find quite a few positive reviews though and so I decided to go for it anyways. ( I think I only paid a few bucks for it during some sale )+ What I like:-Climbing/Stamina System    I love the climbing aspects of this game. I have to sit and carefully plan out my ascent or descent based on how much stamina I have at my disposal. Instead of blindly climbing like in Assasain's Creed, I have to think before I climb. This is the most realistic climbing I have ever seen in a game (in terms of stamina), and I love it so much.-Fighting    The fact that you can intimidate the enemy without any bullets and shove them down a hole is an A+ in my book! Seriously though, this game seems to have a similar theme, "Think before you act". I have found myself analyzing the enemy and finding who to kill first and how to do it. The intimidation that you can produce with an unloaded gun is spectacular and I find myself using it often.-Scenery     This game really sells the post-apocalyptic setting and between the dastardly ambushes and the unsettling music I find myslef on the edge of my seat.+ What I dislike    Honestly there really is not that much I truely dislike about this game. The limited retry is a bit troubling, but it forces me to take my time and analyze every situation. The fighting system is a little tough to get at first but once you get the hang of it, its not too bad.+ My Thoughts    I do indeed recommend this game. I would probably not have bought it if it had not been on sale, and I don't recommend paying $15 for it. If this game does end up going on sale then I recommend getting it, as you will most likely enjoy it as I have.    The trick to this game is to have patience and not rush into things. If you try to play this game like an FPS game, you will not enjoy it. This game is all about conserving the small pile of resources you have while trying to stay alive. It's a refreashing change from the FPS games I usually play.Thanks for reading my review,    TheBalmyScholar

												I have been wanting this game for a long time after I first saw it on Youtube, this game was totally under the radar and it looked so good I just wanted it right then, but at that time there where only a Ps3 verion out, when it finally showed up to PC here on Steam I just grabbed it, so is it worth it? the game is certanly nothing spectacular and the graphics was a bit disapointing even if they are ok I guess, it gives that post apocalyptical atmosphere really good and it have a great story, you have to climb obstacles to move on in the game, sometimes it will be a great challenge because you just can't figure out how to do it. so you have to think your self trough it mostly. it is a climbing game simular to Tombraider, there are bandits on the way you have to take care of. there are no monsters or goblins in this game and was a fresh wind, the game tries it best to realistic simulate the end of the world, the controls are a bit broken and is the bad part of the game, other than that, it is a good game and is entertaining to play, I would recommend pick this game up on sale, if it wasn't for the awkward controls I would have given 7/10 but I will only give a 5 out of 10 for that reason, still it is a recommended buy if you can get it cheap. but I would only recommend it if you like the post apocalyptic genre, if not, there are better games you can blow your money on.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												I would say this game is at least a 7/10. It has an innovative combat system, to were if you aim a gun at someone who has no ranged weapon they will put their hands up, and this means that if there is a fire or cliff nearby, you can kick them into it. However, this gets clunky, and while ammo is scarce if you only pick it up yourself, shoot an enemy that has a gun and  you get your ammo back. A true flaw that feels lazy and unfinished is the story. Your nameless, however not silent protaganist will trust the sketchiest of characters, and the ending doesn't tie up loose ends. It feels as if it was unfinished, or that the studio was going to make a sequel and decided not to do it. Another gripe I have with the game is the stamina. It runs out when you climb, even when standing still on a ledge, which I know from experience is that is not true, and when you are in this "Heavy Fog" as they call it. It's just a lot of dust, and when in it, your stamina goes down, too.  Sure, a dust cloud would impair your breathing, but it wouldn't kill you if you were just walking in it.  I did enjoy playing it, but I want more out of it. It did feel a bit unfinished, and in this review I spoke mostly to the negetives, but if you get this game, you would find that there are plenty of positives, too. So. a great game, just with some glaring flaws. Or at least that's my take on it.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
												Short, but fun.  Play it with a controller.  Dont expect hordes of zombies, lots of guns, or ample supplies of anything.  But if you are frugal, patient, and play smart (this is not a run-n-gun game - kinda like Dead Space), you will be rewarded with a great experience.  The ending is a bit abrupt and may be unrewarding to some, but it didnt bother me.  A post-apocalytic game with no zombies or mutants = refreshingly minimalistic, and unique.  If you want pulse-pounding arcade action, this one isnt for you.  If you want a game that requires you to think before you shoot, and look before you leap, then go for it - especially if its on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												I thought I would enjoy this game despite the critics... I was wrong. It's not awful, but it's clunky and uninspired. You will soon enough realize you are far from the only one who is alive (I certainly didn't feel like a ''lone survivor'' for long... maybe 5 minutes of gameplay?), and the reason for the death of the majority of the population is never explained in any satisfying way. Though the game itself is only moderately challenging, the clunky controls and camera and awful combat make it fairly annoying to play. There is survival aspects at play here, and some work fairly well, but some game mechanics feel unnecessary or cliché. Last but not least, I Am Alive is very linear, which is very much a missed opportunity in this type of game. When you do try to explore, you are often reminded that ''you're going the wrong way'' or something along those lines.As I said above it's not an awful game, but there are so many much, much better games to play that I wouldn't recommend I Am Alive except if you are a complete fan of the genre and you've played every other game already, and it is on sale.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
												A "cinematic" style game before the wave of cinematic style games that gamers have been being beaten over the head with these last few years. I Am Alive is very much driven by story and visuals but aside from that the gameplay is fantastic. It's FPS meets platforming with some lightweight puzzle solving that is all blended together seemlessly, realistically. Probably Ubisoft's only perfect game, and definitely their last truely good game made. Only downside is that much like a good movie it is over too soon. 2 sweaty palms out of 2.

												I think this is one of the more exciting and challenging single player games out there. 												This game was stuck in developmental hell for 10 years until it finally got pooped out some years back.  It's not a great game by any means, although you can see the potential for it. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 2, 2016
												Oh man... And I was so hyped about this game also. :(I think it has lot of potential: post apocalyptic games always do, but the color world is awesome, the atmosphere is nice and the graphics are not bad.But... everything else is. SPOILER ALERT!!! The first intro gives you a clue that you are not going to make it, so what´s the point even trying!? I mean come on! It´s a survival game! And yes a game where the main character dies can sometimes give it a little (or a lot) of that emotional richness that makes you remember the experience your whole life, but if your dead is not a suprise, it´s really just a bummer.In my opinion, it´s also too limited a game. In a survival game you should be able to explore a little, be creative with your choises, but in this game it´s very stricht what route you can take and what choises to make.I like the extra bit of nervousness when you start losing your stamina, but it´s also irritating when you´ll have the constant remainder of lost energy teasing you. I´d prefer if you didn´t need food etc. to gain the lost max. stamina, but enough rest would do the job and you could see the stamina-bar filling up. (And IF it´s already in the game, it´s not fast enough ´cause I waited for quite a long time to see, if the max. stamina would recover itself with time.)I think if the game would get more of an open world -feel to it, (and btw, the controls are confusing as h*ll. I mean rmb for pointing gun AND dropping down rom a hight, space for climbing AND jumping, lmb pressing and tapping for running and runnin faster? Why do you need to run faster, when you can just run?), so less confusing controls, maybe a little editing on the intro and MORE CHOISES AVAILABLE IN EVERYTHING and I think this would make a wonderful game. but for now, I think I will not be playing it for a long while.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
 A Great Game If You Like Something Different and Don't Care About Graphics This game is actually pretty great, I was put off by the mixed reviews, but most of the reviews seemed to dislike the graphical style, but not have genuine criticisms for the game. So here is my list of the pros and cons of this game and whether you should buy it or not! Pros  Semi-Open world design Tense Gameplay Unique style and mechanics Unique Combat Morality choices More strategic stance on climbing gameplay Makes you conserve resources Death has real consequence Cons  Sometimes gets tedious While gameplay is interesting, it is quite clunky Mistakes are harshly punished Story is a bit lack-luster Characters are flat Not enough information is given about the backstory of this world Enemy AI can be a bit weird Some may find the art style (grey with only some things being in color) unimmersive The Graphics are not that goodSo those are the pros and cons to I Am Alive! I would recommend this game for someone who values a challenge and craves something new. If you do decide to pick this game up you want to buy it on sale and be prepared for a good experience, but nothing amazing. 7/10

content:
Posted: April 2
												I have no Idea why so many people are torn on this game. Clunky gameplay? Sure in a few aspects, but that's no reason to give this game a negative. This game has immersed me in a atmosphere like very few other games have, I like their take on combat, it is psychological and does further to make it feel like a survival of the fittest apocalypse. It was very refreshing to play an apocalyptic video game that wasn't a ♥♥♥♥ing zombie apocalypse. It was a unique setting and situation. My only complaint is that the game was short, the story never truly finishes. It's a shame a sequel for this will not happen. Another complaint is that the main character was a bit bland but his story was very interesting.Overall Rating: 8/10Worth every penny for it's price.
